intro: Paris daiswus, commonly known as the greater mouse-ear cress, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe, North Africa, and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features basal leaves that are lobed or toothed. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Paris daiswus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
